abstract: Pharmaceutical companies are facing increasing pressure to reveal development costs and profits of very expensive drugs they make; so-called drug cost transparency legislation has been introduced in at least six states in last year, and is intended to force firms to justify their prices; trend is highlighted by Mayo Clinic Proceedings article from 100 prominent oncologists moving to stem soaring prices for cancer drugs.
lead_paragraph: Pharmaceutical cost transparency bills have been introduced in at least six states in the last year, aiming to make drug makers explain their prices.

headline.main: Drug Prices Soar, Prompting Calls for Justification
headline.print_headline: Drug Companies Increasingly Pushed to Explain High Prices

snippet: Pharmaceutical cost transparency bills have been introduced in at least six states in the last year, aiming to make drug makers explain their prices.
